CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1962, pg. 7, reads: "Aiding Children's Camps - Dan T. Mosse (left), president of the Galen Pharmaceutical Society, and Maurice Fierman, projects chairman and president-elect of the society, are shown as they turned over $1,100 worth of medical and first-aid supplies to eight local non-profit children's camps recently, at Campbell's Drug Store, Penn and Highland, East Liberty. The children and their representative camps are (left to right) Robert Jones, 9, Camp Achievement; Cynthia Hornicak, 9, of 2412 Jane St., Camp Claudine Virginia Trees; Richard Hall, Camp James Weldon Johnson; Helen and Kim Jones, ages 3 and 4, brother of Richard, and John Forrester, 11, or 751 Rossmere, Camp Joe Benedum Trees. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left, Robert Jones, Dan T. Mosse, Cynthia Hornicak, Richard Hall, Helen Jones, Kim Jones, John Forrester in background, and Maurice Fierman, in Campbell's Drug Store, East Liberty
